title: Kevin De Bruyne OUT of Manchester City's game against Wolves
text:
Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola has confirmed Kevin De Bruyne will not be fit to face Wolves on Sunday.

The Belgium international missed the midweek Champions League clash with Dinamo Zagreb due to a groin injury.

'He is not fit,' said Guardiola. 'After the international break he will be ready. It is not a big problem.'

Kevin De Bruyne is not fit to play for Manchester City in their game against Wolves

De Bruyne had to sit out of City's Champions League win over Dinamo Zagreb this week, too

Guardiola, meanwhile, also gave his backing to Kyle Walker, who was once again omitted from the England squad by national boss Gareth Southgate.

'Gareth does what he thinks is best for England,' he said. 'For Kyle it is a big challenge to show how good he is. He remains an incredible full-back.'

On the fitness of John Stones, the Spanish coach added: 'Hopefully after the international break he will be ready.'
description: The Belgium international missed the midweek Champions League clash with Dinamo Zagreb due to a groin injury, and Pep Guardiola has now confirmed that he is still not fit to return to action.
